intro: Impatiens nyimana, commonly known as the Congo velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to central and western Africa. It is characterized by its dark green, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae, which includes other popular garden plants like the common impatiens. Impatiens nyimana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
